title: What is the significance of the virgin symbol in Isiac and Saturnian mysteries, and what is the role of priestesses in preparing for social crises according to divine justice?
first_phrase: In the previous text, the author talks about the importance of keeping the covenant and not breaking the dam that separates us from the rest of humanity unless it's necessary under certain circumstances. In this last part, the author discusses the role of priestesses in Isiac and Saturnalian mysteries and debunks the notion of their supposed sexual rites. These priestesses performed higher-order duties to prepare for desired events according to divine justice, often marked by the seal of virginity. The text reflects on the importance of staying on the righteous path without succumbing to worldly desires and urges readers to seek the help of higher intelligences.
content: Ne' concupiscenza di ricchezze, ne' lussuria di poteri, ne' libidine di amori profani ti scuotano dalla retta via, la quale se tu non abbandoni, vedrai che senza violentare la liberta' e la volontà' del tuo simile potrai essere ricco di ogni più' abbagliante ricchezza materiale, di ogni potere seducente, di ogni apparenza onorifica, perché' le cose che tu non. desidererai per te, ma per fare il bene, per spargere e profondere la felicita' dove tu cammini, ed in questo caso non avrai che a chiedere e a domandare senza desiderio di orgoglio plebeo e gli spiriti eletti ti serviranno a mensa e nella via come al Re dei volghi i servi pagati faranno corte. 42) Le sacerdotesse nei misteri isiaci e saturniali, che un vólgo di ignoranti grammatici converti del gesuitismo più' scevro di morale dipingono come orge e debosce sacerdotali non compivano innanzi agli iniziabili nei misteri occulti del sacerdozio che queste mansioni e questi doveri di ordine più' elevato, per preparare avvenimenti desiderati o voluti secondo la giustizia della Prima Virtù' o □ (vedi n. 1) e il suggello della verginità' era appunto questo segno □ pari al segno della prima virtù'.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the path to true wealth and power lies not in the pursuit of material possessions, lust, or profane love, but in the desire to do good and spread happiness wherever one goes. The ancient priestesses of the Isiac and Saturnian mysteries were not engaged in debauchery, but in the sacred duties of their high calling, preparing the way for desired outcomes through the purity of their being. The Virgo was not a woman who had never had her hymen pierced, but an agent of occult powers who had achieved a state of supreme consciousness. Through passive induction and careful training, the mistresses of our supreme initiatic rite are brought to a degree of hypersensitivity and obtuseness that allows them to perform their purifying mission with utmost intensity.
